messages.message: Isn't there already a product called Converse?

I'm being facetious, but in all seriousness, are we _sure_ we want to use the same name as a HUGELY recognizable brand?

This is not good SEO: you can't google "Converse" and get results related to Instabase.

Also, it complicates pronunciation for the English-speaking world, who probably mostly say CONverse, then have to awkwardly correct themselves
I know this has probably been discussed, but I'm getting paid to think about taxonomy and naming, so just wanted to flag this.

I’ve been calling this CON-verse like the shoes, or like you would say to mean “the inverse” since we changed the name. I’ve noticed many other folks also saying it this way, more often than the way we’re supposed to say it. English is just too confusing.
